inn1.comm: starts full on middle stump, searching for some swing, flicked to square leg
full outside off, swings away further and is left alone
touch wide outside off again, Cook not interested at the moment
beaten! Closer to off stump, Cook goes for a drive and it goes past the inside edge. Not far from the stumps. It didn't actually do too much
pushed down the leg side so England are up and running
gets squared up a little by a full delivery on middle and off which straightens as he aims to play to leg...takes a thick outside edge along the ground to point
good length outside off, Cook presses forward and defends to cover...decent opening over
full outside off, 79mph, defended into the covers
full outside off, shaping away, left alone
getting a nice bit of shape, just a steady pace, defended on the front foot
tight line outside off, left alone
keeps it full outside off, Bell gets a decent stride into the ball this and defends to cover
lovely way to get off the mark, stands tall and drives a back-of-a-length delivery through square cover...not quite the legs to reach the boundary
reaches in front of his body, not quite getting his foot to the pitch, and the ball dribbles towards mid-on
back of a length on off stump, Cook stays back and works towards mid-on

well bowled! He's given lbw but Cook reviews. Looks out. Well bowled by McClenaghan, beaten by one that nips back off the seam and beats the inside edge. Crashing into middle and leg. A very poor review from the captain.
pushed across the right hander outside off, left alone
makes him play this time, on off stump, Trott presses forward and defends towards cover
shorter of a length this time, doesn't seem a huge amount of pace in the pitch and Trott has ample time to wait and then open the face to find third man
first bouncer of the day, it's outside off stump and loops through to Ronchi...not far from a wide
back of a length, Trott moves across and plays towards midwicket
tuck off the pads, sweetly timed towards midwicket
not bowling as full to Trott as he did to Bell, he plays towards point off the back foot
there's the fuller one, nice delivery outside off, just hints at moving away from Trott as he leaves alone
full on off, Trott goes to drive but doesn't quite get the timing as he finds mid-on
beaten playing a slightly flat-footed drive, it was a tempting full length outside off and Bell went for a booming drive
similar ball, but this time he goes the cautious route and shoulders arms
back of a length, tucked off the body towards midwicket
tight on off stump, quite close to the body but Bell tries to cut and gets it towards second slip
going across Bell outside off and it's left alone again
on middle and leg, worked to midwicket

short of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man and Trott sprints back for a well-judged second...there is a direct hit from third man, but he's well home (excellent work, though, by McClenaghan on the boundary)
played into the off side
very full outside off, giving it every chance to swing, Trott comes forward to drive but only finds mid-off
opens the face to drive this time and picks out cover
now he's offered a looser delivery, short and wide outside off, but he can't cash in as he cuts straight to point
back on a tight line outside
his first ball is driven firmly through the covers, slides off the face of the bat as the it turns in Bell's hands but there's more excellent fielding by New Zealand to chase it down
dragged wider outside off, left alone

goes over the cover ring this time, he didn't try to keep this one along the deck and although it wasn't a million miles from the fielders it was fairly safe and well timed...first boundary of the day
driven off a thick outside edge to point
full on off stump, Bell comes well forward and defends with bat and pad together
drags the length back a fraction, this one does move at all, Bell defends to the off side
back of a length outside off, Trott goes across his stumps and flicks it neatly to midwicket
dragged down short and Trott latches on, pulls it in the over square leg and with enough power to beat long leg
nice shot and excellent fielding...Trott flicked this with a strong bottom hand from well outside off towards Franklin, who was able to dive to his strong left-hand side
another elegant-looking drive off the front foot but it goes straight to mid-off
short of a length outside off, angled towards gully where B Mac pulls off another good diving save...New Zealand right on top of their game
still can't quite find the gap, but a rare fumble by mid-off, who parries the ball behind him, gives Trott the chance for a couple
that's a sparkling shot from Bell...given some width from Southee, Bell frees his arms and sends it rifling through the covers
full again, but a touch straighter, Bell drives with a sweet ping off his bat to mid-off
this wasn't a bad delivery, was heading towards middle and off, but Bell steps across his stumps and flicks it with beautiful timing wide of mid-on
first delivery with the changed ball is full outside off, defended with his head over the line
onto the front foot, played back to the bowler
touch shorter and wider outside off, Bell happy to let it go through to the keeper
starts to come down the pitch a little, then chops a wide delivery towards backward point
tries to make room for himself this time, good response from Mills who fires in a yorker and Trott has to jab down quickly
pushed off the front foot towards mid-on, Trott appears to think about a single which almost does for Bell but he manages to get back to his crease comfortably enough
beaten outside off by one that bounces a fraction more than Trott expected as he tried to angle it down to third man
well struck, full on middle and off, Trott whips it straight of mid-on...not quite a textbook straight drive, a hint more 'shovel' in it...it beats the diving fielder
back of a length outside off, dropped towards mid-off but Trott judges well that there's a single on offer
over the wicket, angled across outside off, Trott chops down on a full delivery
Trott walks across outside off and tries to work a length delivery wide of mid-on but finds the man
full and slanted across, punched towards mid-off for a quick single
back of a length and Bell is hit on the thigh pad in front of the stumps
fullish, quite wide and Bell slashes unsuccessfully, doesn't get anything on it
length delivery outside the line of off, defended back down the track
pitched up outside off and steered square into the off side
short and around the line of off, Trott goes across and works to leg
back of a length outside off, Bell dabs it defensively straight down and over the top of his off stump... pretty, pretty close, that
fuller length, nipping back towards middle and off, presses forward and an inside edge rolls through backward square
length delivery, drops back in the crease and glides a single to third man
gets on the front foot, opens the face and pushes into the covers
angled across on a length, played back towards mid-on, again looking for that on-side gap
nicely timed, driven on the up wide of mid-off but an excellent diving stop prevents any reward
full and straight and punched neatly straight back, Franklin gets a flick on it and mid-on keeps them to one
here we go, Trott on the charge, choo-choo full steam ahead - he skips out and lofts a length ball back over the bowler's head for a boundary down the ground
on the stumps, Trott shuffles across and clips to deep square leg
length delivery around middle and off, again worked through square off the pads for a single
full and outside off, pushed into the covers
straighter line and Bell works the ball through midwicket
pitched up in the channel, opens the face and steers in front of square
bumper, doesn't get up that much, Trott swivels to pull low towards deep midwicket
full of a length outside off, driven wide of mid-off and they scamper one, Nathan McCullum's shy at the non-striker's end going high
again Trott walks across, taking a length ball around off in front of deep midwicket with a flick of the wrists
full and sliding away outside off, defended
drops short and Bell swats a pull shot in front of deep midwicket for a couple
overpitched, powderpuff stuff from Franklin and Bell leans back to chip over the leaping McCullum at mid-off for four - little bit of risk but he is rewarded
gets forward to block a length ball
round the wicket now, waits, opens the face and steers to third man
pitched up and punched down the ground for a single to long-on
short and wide and slapped firmly ... straight to Williamson at backward point. Southee gets away with one
again a bit of width, length delivery and Trott chops it into the ground towards the same fielder
Trott gets half forward, drops the ball short on the off side, Williamson again charges in to collect
excellent placement from Trott, taking a length ball on the up and clipping it through midwicket for four
goes back and across and guides a single down to third man
length delivery in the channel, good carry through to the keeper as Bell shoulders arms
over the wicket to the right-handers, firmly nudged in between mid-on and midwicket, they get back for a second
full and angled across, punched cleanly to mid-off
length delivery, shaping away a little out of the hand, Trott gets a leading edge into the off side trying to play through mid-on
pitched up and clipped wide of mid-on, who stumbles in fielding but they think twice about a second run
speared across on the full, dabbed down to third man
outside off and deflected towards point with an open bat face
pushed through wide of off stump, goes back and cuts into the ground wide of backward point for one
length delivery, bit of air outside off, tapped into the leg side
tossed up outside off, Bell goes down on one knee and cross-bats to long-on
outside off, steered to backward point from the crease
floated up around the line of off, clipped firmly to midwicket
pushed through a bit quicker on the stumps, worked round the corner to deep backward square

full and beats Trott's clip across the line, hit on the pad and given! McClenaghan has done it again, though he's had a bit of assistance from Alastair Cook because that delivery looked like it was missing off stump... England have no reviews left, though, and Trott has to walk. It was Tim Robinson's call again, the ball rapped the pad low in front of off but although it looked like it would have gone on across the stumps, Hawk Eye showed it to be just clipping. So a review wouldn't have saved Trott either
on the stumps, Root gets across to defend
full and driven into the off side
bowling round the wicket now, full length, punched back towards mid-off
angled in towards middle and leg, worked off the pads for a couple through midwicket
goes back over the wicket, length delivery defended in front of the stumps
tossed up and played back to the bowler
on the stumps, punched down the ground to long-on
played back to the bowler
tossed up on the stumps and worked through the leg side
pushed through wide of the stumps, sits back and steers to backward point
full and worked off the pads through midwicket
length ball on middle and off, clipped into a gap wide of deep midwicket
similar line, a touch shorter, clipped down to long leg
little further outside off on a length, pushed to point
full and straighter - more off stump this - tucked to midwicket
just back of a length, pulled, it wasn't short enough to pull really, gets a bottom edge past the stumps and keeper and gets a fluky four to fine leg
back pitched up just outside off, pushed into the covers
full on off stump, clipped just wide of midwicket
flighted on off stump, chipped very safely down to long on
fuller ball punched to long on from just outside off
played to the same fielder, this time with a flick off the back foot
little unsure about the length, ends up staying in the crease and blocking around off stump
touch fuller and clipped down to long on
full just outside off stump, a well-timed drive just wide of mid-off, the fielder slides and keeps it down to just a single
back of a length just outside off, guided into the ground and it evades backward point and gully both diving towards it, third man scrambles well to his right and saves the second
similar line but fuller so Bell shoulders arms
little fuller again and Bell goes out to drive this, in the air for a while but in front of backward point and the sweeper comes in to save the second
fullest ball of the over, on the stumps, clipped to mid on
driven from just outside off, gets it off the inner half of the bat back up past the bowler, mid-on comes in to save the run
nicely swept off middle and off, can't quite beat deep midwicket
forward and pressed from just outside off to extra cover
another off drive and again extra cover saves very well
chipped into the leg side and a dive from Guptill drops the catch one-handed down to his left, very tough chance
played on the crease around middle and off trying to work to leg
full length wide of off stump to driven and gets it out to deep cover
back of a length just outside off stump, cut at hard and finds the sweeper
full ball on the stumps, pressed forward to mid-on
slower ball on a length on leg stump, Bell flicks it and can't beat the short long leg
driven from just outside off, again only a single to the sweeper out at cover
slower ball again, on off stump, Root waits for it and clips out wide of deep midwicket for a couple
dropped to point from just outside off staying in the crease
stays in the crease and punches a length ball down to long on
back in the crease again, clips through square leg, they run hard but not hard enough to beat deep square leg
just outside off stump, Bell late cuts wide of short third man and brings the hundred up
width to play with again, cut hard and runs it out to deep cover
short enough to pull, gently paddled really, out to deep square leg
gives himself a little room and punches to deep cover
starts a little short outside off, Bell cut hard but straight to deep cover
Root back on his stumps, misses with a flick to leg, big cry for lbw from the bowler, not out given, they consider and then decline the option of a review, probably too high
does flick this to leg but only finds midwicket
back away to force this off the back foot but again only find midwicket
finally gets off strike with a flick down the ground to a ball just backward of a good length
back and cutting hard to the cover sweeper, 50 for Bell, a nice start
back and pushed into the covers
full ball on the stumps, tucked down to long on
forward trying to flick down the ground, the bowler dives to his right to save
back and chopped away behind point, wide enough of the sweeper for a second
full length, clipped into the on-side, a good diving save from Guptill at midwicket
length ball, gets across his stumps and flicks down to long on
full ball on the stumps, flicked down to long on
Root find the same fielder off the front foot
tossed up on the off stump, just blocked coming forward
full, pushed into midwicket, they run on the fumble, Guptill was sliding to his left
back and dropped into the covers, they take a quick run wide of cover
taken from outside off and slog swept over midwicket, well timed, gets it to cow corner for a rare boundary
length ball on the stumps, clipped to square leg
full ball, pushed to midwicket
forward just outside off, played forward and squeezed to short third man
length ball on the stumps, flicked out through square leg
tossed up and clipped down to long on from just outside off
clipped back to the bowler aiming for long on again, the bowler fields well
comes round the wicket, driven to cover
back of a length, he drives again but it goes to mid-off
that's a top shot from Bell, he drives on the up through the line and sends it high down the ground...clears the straight boundary
finds the gap out to the cover sweeper
worked off the back foot through wicket
played into the off side
too short and wide outside off, nicely cut through backward point and more good running between the wickets
pushed easily down the ground to long-on
lovely use of the wrists this time by Root as he drives through the off side, but Colin Munro makes an excellent diving save on the cover boundary
worked out to midwicket
goes back and cuts a short delivery through the off side
defended off the back foot, it was quite short and Root is disappointed he wasn't at least able to work a single
starts with a gentle delivery on leg stump, flicked in the air through square leg
drives with a straighter bat this time, but it squirts off a thick inside edge to deep square
pushed down the ground to long-on
full outside off, another lovely lofted drive by Bell, this time over extra cover, which clears Brendon McCullum and races to the fence
short of a length, tucked along the ground through midwicket
driven down the ground to long-off
shuffles down the track a little then bunts to mid-off
flicked from outside off to midwicket
again outside off to that man at midwicket who is being kept busy
shorter this time and gives Root to tuck it off the back foot into square leg
played with a straight bat into the leg side and can't find a gap

breakthrough, against the run of play...worked down the on side, Williamson dived in his follow through which parried it towards midwicket. Because the ball had gone past the non-striker, Root, he stayed in his ground a fraction longer before running...the throw to Ronchi was quite wide of the stumps - although Guptill had been so quick from midwicket - but he did very well to gather it and reach the stumps. Replays show it was a matter of one camera frame, but Root was a inch or two short.
on off stump, defending to mid-off
full outside, driven with a late turn of the wrists to send it wide of deep cover
tucked towards midwicket where the fielding isn't so good this time as he dives over the ball

maybe it was a tactical mis-field! Double breakthrough for New Zealand. The return of McClenaghan does the trick again as Bell drives straight to mid-off who was inside the circle. Simple catch. Lazy shot, really bad time to depart. End of a neat of innings
comes round the wicket, good line just outside off stump, he plays just inside the line
fuller and worked to point
beaten outside off, reaching for quite a wide delivery
worked from off stump into the on side
taken from around off stump to midwicket
outside leg stump, that gets him underway as he nudges it out to deep square-leg
driven into the off side
holds this one back a fraction, Morgan pushes it in the air towards cover but it falls well short
continues round the wicket, this wide outside off, Bopara throws his hands at it and gets a thick edge down to third man who slides around the boundary to cut it off
straighter this time, at off stump, Bopara nicely in line as he drives it hard into the pitch then it bounces back to McClenaghan
close! Did that stop in the surface? Bopara was early on his shot and the ball went in the air towards Guptill at short cover but landed just in front of him
dropped and now this one whistles back past McClenaghan's left hand as Bopara drives in the air again...perhaps didn't come back as quickly as the bowler thought
defended into the off side
very full, on the popping crease, driven square to deep point...not an easy start for Bopara
drifts outside leg stump, worked backward of square on the leg side
gets lucky here...Morgan aimed to go over the off side and was beaten by some spin, got a thick outside edge high in the air but it just cleared point and cover
worked down the ground
comes forward and defends, Morgan doesn't look confident at all
driven to cover
uses his feet, ends up yorking himself and can only work it down to long-on to keep the strike
over the wicket, played with a slightly open face towards backward point

manages to just about find the middle of the bat this time, it was full and wide, tempting the drive, and Bopara responded by going in the air through the off side but it is hauled in just before the boundary
pushed across outside off, left alone
full and wide outside off, this time Morgan goes after it and drives out to deep point
full on middle and leg, neatly whipped towards mid-on who can't stop it cleanly which allows Bopara back for a second
driven into the on side, fielded cleanly this time
driven into the off side
comes onto the front, plays with an open face to try and find a gap...New Zealand won't mind singles
there's another one as Bopara props forward and pushes square to the off side
fraction shorter, played off the back foot towards midwicket
brilliant fielding! Is Bopara short? He drove towards cover, thought it would beat Brendon McCullum but his was a superb dive, turn and throw to hit direct. Bopara, however, has just made it
played into the off side
Southee continues, slightly full and outside the line of off, opens the face and steers through backward point
fired across, full and swirling away, called wide
pitched up in the channel, not as wide this time but Morgan still has to reach out to chop to point
drags this shorter, plenty of width for Morgan to throw the hands and pat a single to third man
tighter line around off to the right-hander, defended coming forwards
length ball outside the line of off, coming back in a touch and driven on the up to backward point
fullish length tailing back in towards middle and leg, clipped to the man at midwicket
tossed wide of the wicket, goes back and cross-bats one through backward point
pushed through around the line of off, pushed back to the bowler
flat, angled in around off, defended back to Williamson again
drops a touch short, Bopara steps out and drops to one knee to pull flat through midwicket for a couple
leg-stump line, sits in the crease and pats back down the track
on the stumps, clipped into a gap in front of midwicket for a comfortable single
angling in on the pads, Bopara whips a fullish delivery through midwicket

Morgan makes a little shuffle down the track, Mills fires it full and wide and the batsman manages to shovels it through cover, difficult for him to reach but Morgan's strong wrists earn England a boundary
pushed across, on a length and left... because it was wide
tighter, still a good length, Morgan blocks towards point
walks across his stumps, angled across on a slightly full length and defended
comes forward and turns a length ball into something fuller, punches back past the bowler and mid-on scampers across to cut it off
line and length around off stump, Bopara taps into the covers
spinning in from outside off and Bopara tries to sweep, is hit on the pad but was outside the line
flat trajectory, pushed across and Morgan works through midwicket
advances and clips the ball towards mid-on
drops a touch short and there again signs of greater expansiveness from Bopara, who stands tall and thrashes a cut in front of square, Munro doing well to cut it off in the deep
tossed up and swept hard, the man on the 45 should cut it off but it bobbles through him for a couple

Williamson's line drifts down the leg side and Morgan, who had edged across, plays an impudent French cricket dab, sort of a vertical sweep fine past the man on the edge of the circle for another boundary
on a length and turned through the leg side for a quick single
goes slightly wider and fired across, Morgan hops out and chops the ball into the ground
back of a length in the channel, Bopara waits on it and softly guides one behind point
length ball, pushed across, skips out and punches to the sweeper - that's the fifty partnership up, off 60 balls
full and in the channel, Bopara winds up and inside-edges past his stumps for one to fine leg
goes across and tickles another single to third man... bit more urgency now, though with only five overs to go, it may be a little late
tossed up and Morgan reverses the hands to take one through backward point
tossed up and punched wristily through the covers, again Munro covers good ground on the fence to cut it off
wider, very full and Bopara swats at it, goes slightly aerial towards mid-off but bounces before Brendon McCullum
round the wicket, goes back and hacks one through the covers

full and straight and Bopara goes big... but not big enough and is caught on the fence at deep midwicket! Bopara unpacked his slog-sweep but the ball came off the top edge and went high rather than far: out rather than six
tapped off the pads through backward square
very full, pretty much a leg-stump yorker but maybe drifting down slightly and McClenaghan's appeal is rejected
pitched up wide of the stumps, stands in the crease and drives through the covers
full toss that Morgan doesn't quite latch on to, manages to carve the ball over the ring and out towards deep extra cover
stays back and taps short on the off side
round the wicket to Morgan, too straight though and a full ball lands right in Morgan's 'smash it' arc, he gets a full swing of the arms and bunts it high over deep midwicket and into the stands
well-directed bouncer, wide of the stumps and this takes Morgan by surprise, misses with a flick
short and straight and cracked back flat over wide long-on, just an unfussy jab really, lot of bottom arm power and the ball sails over the ropes
Buttler has shown us power, now it's his deft touch, walking across outside off stump and ramping a full ball over the man on the edge of the circle for four to long leg
overpitched, very straight and clubbed hard off the pads, bisecting the two men out towards deep midwicket

takes the pace off and tries to go very wide as Buttler walks across, looking to flick the ball to leg again, he spots the line and readjusts, reverse-paddling the ball just over the diving short third man, tremendous power in the wrists!
slower ball in the channel, Buttler had backed away this time and swings hard but misses
length ball, again a touch slower and seen like it's a beach ball, stands up and thwacks it straight back down the ground like he's Jack Nicklaus in his prime
good ball from McClenaghan, very full and ducking back in as Morgan tries to clear his front leg, hits him on the pad
pitched up on the stumps again, manages to dig the ball out towards midwicket ... and McClenaghan had overstepped
McClenaghan comes up with a method of not getting hit - bowling a beamer about two yards outside off stump, which is called a no-ball on height
stays round the wicket, full and wide... too wide, outside the tramlines, more extras and Buttler will still get the free hit on the next ball
well, he's a little unlucky there but McClenghan had dug that hole himself, this was pitched up wide of the wicket, Buttler swung hard and sliced four to third man
four more past the keeper, this time to his left via a Chinese cut! Full bunger outside off again, Buttler jammed his bat down late and just managed to squirt it to the rope via an inside edge
back over the wicket, good short ball across the man, missed trying to swat off the back foot
slower-ball bouncer, it's very short and will be called wide... and they manage to run a bye too
full toss around off stump, Morgan gets right under it trampolines the ball waaaaaaaaaaaay back over long-on for another Dorothy! These two have added 55 in 19 balls!
bouncer again, outside off and although it looked a little high, as Morgan tried to uppercut it, McClenaghan is allowed some respite
length ball, clears the front leg but can only scuff a single into the leg side
goes round the wicket, pitched up and it's in that zone again, Morgan loves to hit down the ground and he brutalises this over long-off for six more!
tapped short into the off side and a direct hit runs Morgan out! Superb bit of fielding, he was scampering hard for the single that would take him to fifty but the dive couldn't save him

hello! Can we have our ball back please! Southee didn't get the yorker right, Buttler stepped away and was able to get right under the ball and lift it miles back into the stands at long-on - I think that was caught in the second tier!
tries to go full and wide but doesn't quite get it inside the tramlines
hammered over deep cover, another huge swing of the bat and that's six more for Buttler! He stepped away and belaboured the ball into the crowd with another thunderous stroke

not quite, though it only lands a few feet short! Southee banged it and Buttler sort of windmilled it back down the ground, hard to get a clean hit and long-off comes round to prevent it bouncing for four

inn2.comm: big appeal for lbw first ball! Nips back off a good length, but there's a big inside edge as it rolls away to gully
another inside edge, this time by Guptill as he drives at a full delivery and edges it into his pads
pushed down the leg side, easy call for the umpire
back of a length, nips off the seam again, Guptill shapes to play it to the leg side and it comes off his hip
back of a length, Guptill defends into the off side
loses his line down the leg side again, just pushing the ball a little bit
that's where Finn wants to be, tight on off stump, not allowing Guptill to plant on the front foot, and it's defended to the off side
gets more help off the seam, cramps Guptill for room a little as he defends towards point...a mixed opening over from Finn
starts full and wide, it swings away further, Ronchi chases after it and drives high over backward point for his first boundary in New Zealand colours
chance! Has to go down as a drop by Morgan at point...it was a fierce drive by Ronchi, scorched off the bat as he drove without much footwork, and it beat Morgan for pace
gets closer to off stump, Ronchi goes to leave the ball and it runs off the bat down to third man who is very wide
short of a length outside off, opens the face with more control this time off the back foot and finds third man
straightens his line to Guptill, it glances off the pad down to long leg...there's an appeal from Broad and, quite amusingly, complete silence from everywhere else
full on off stump, defended firmly back to Broad in his follow through
full and wide, dispatched with authority from Guptill as he strides towards the ball and drives imperiously through the line
a better delivery, not so floaty or wide, just outside off stump, defended to the covers
whipped away, the shot of a player full of confidence, it was straight on line for middle and off but that doesn't matter when it finds the middle of the bat through straight midwicket
outside off stump, opens the face to find the gap backward of point
short of a length, angled into the body, and Ronchi tucks it towards midwicket
good delivery, on middle and off, just a hint of it straightening and Ronchi defends to mid-off
full on off stump, driven into the pitch and back to Broad
drags the length shorter and it's played off the back foot with a slightly open face
banged in short, good pace at 89mph, and it's pulled away without too much conviction but doesn't go close to the midwicket fielder
dodgy run! Dropped towards backward point, there was hesitation as Morgan runs in and it would have been touch and go for Ronchi with a direct hit
on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
not convincing, but very effective, as he flat-bat pulls a delivery that was barely short and gets it over the head of mid-on
full on off stump, driven back towards Finn and not too far from carrying on the full
short of a length outside off, dropped down towards the slips
goes full this time, he comes forward and defends square to point
worked away from off stump between mid-on and midwicket
outside off stump, on that inbetween length where the batsman isn't sure whether to be forward or back, and it's defended to backward point
pushed into the off side and another well-judged single
short of a length, he opens the face again and gets it down to third man
these two have (mostly) run superbly so far, Guptill drops this just by his feet and there is no danger as they both respond at the same time
a booming flat-footed drive and the ball bounces a touch more beating the top edge...wasn't as full as he thought
handsome drive to a fuller delivery, it zings off the bat but goes straight to mid-off
hands on hips for Broad as this is a well-controlled steer down to third man who is too fine to cut off the boundary
that will improve his mood, Broad's pace - in the high 80s - has troubled Ronchi and he splices a pull which loops to mid-on. The umpire wants to check the no-ball and it is mighty close
on a full length, pushes towards the off side, gets an inside edge into his pad
defended with more solidity this time to point
that's how you play the short ball, Guptill plays an effortless pull which goes one bounce over the deep-square leg boundary...he was pressing forward and still had so much time
that's an awful delivery, outside leg stump and it's a gift to Guptill who flicks it away fine of long leg
better delivery, on off stump, defended to backward point
glorious from Guptill, now he unfurls a top-notch straight drive as Finn, who has struggled for consistency, over-pitches and gets drilled through straight mid-off
comes forward and drives, gets a thick inside edge that goes through his legs and runs towards square leg
back of a length, 81mph, Guptill plays with soft hands into the off side
neatly worked away through the leg side, nicely timed, and places it well for a brace
banged in short, fine leg is up, Guptill hooks it for six...he's off and running again, and I'm not sure how smart that was from Broad
back full and outside, defended to the off side
my oh my, what a short that is...short of a length outside off, Guptill stands tall and drives on the up off the back foot through the covers. He'll want to bottle this form
starts with a good delivery on middle and off which squares up Williamson
tucked to midwicket
top shot and well fielded...Williamson punched a very neat on-drive, but Finn put in the full dive from mid-on and cut them down to a single
not quite so full this time, pushed firmly to mid-on
big appeal for lbw as this one nips back off the seam, but all that happens is that New Zealand get four leg-byes down to third man...it was too high for lbw
swipes across the line of a delivery angled towards middle leg but can't make clean contact
looped up on off stump, turned to midwicket
dragged down a fraction short outside off, cut firmly into the off side and cover is a little deep to stop the single
defended back to the bowler
outside off stump and driven again, beats Tredwell's drive but mid-off is behind him

beauty! Graeme Swann would have been proud of that and spin does for Guptill. Turns sharply from just outside off stump and sails through the gate left by Guptill as he shaped to push into the off side
blocked gently towards the leg side
gets a bottom edge back towards the keep as he tries to cut a slightly wide delivery
tighter to off stump, defended quite late by Williamson towards gully

classy stroke, short of a length outside off and he punches it square off the back foot - close to a trademark shot for Williamson - and it's very well fielded by Trott at third who dives and just manages to keep everything inside the boundary
another big shout for lbw, but look high again and maybe an edge...decent 'nip' from Bresnan from short of a length and it did beat the stroke
driven square off the back foot to point
short of a length on leg stump, flicked down to long leg
flicked from off stump to square leg
slightly short, nicely timed off the back foot to long-on
tossed up on off stump, driven into the pitch and bounces back to Tredwell
good line outside off stump, that attack line on about a fifth stump, but Taylor plays it well and gets a single to point
turned from off stump through midwicket
very neat paddle sweep, was a full delivery on off stump, he went down early and sent it through short fine leg
excellent bouncer, 82mph, over middle and off, Taylor has to jerk his head out of the line at the last moment
short of a length outside off stump, a tight run as Morgan comes in from point and Williamson has to get the dive out although the underarm flick missed
nicely worked off the back foot through midwicket and a fumble at deep midwicket by Finn allows them back for a second
another short ball, outside off stump this time, Williamson drops his hands and is very comfortable
he's very good off the back foot, this is another short-of-a-length delivery and he picks his spot through straight midwicket to split the men on the boundary
tries to drop this by his feet in the off side, but it runs too quickly to backward point for a single
a fraction short, Taylor goes onto the back foot but drills it straight back to the bowler
fuller now, Taylor is well forward and whips to midwicket
paddle-sweep again from outside off stump through short fine-leg
flicked to midwicket off the back foot
uses his feet, drives firmly towards mid-off, Broad can't pick up cleanly but Williamson would have been safe anyway
taken from wide outside off, worked towards square leg and Taylor just has to get a shuffle on as throw comes to the non-striker's end
straight delivery worked to midwicket
worked neatly from outside off stump in front of square on the leg side...a very comfortable requirement for New Zealand so long as they have wickets in hand
driven off the back foot to square cover
bouncer from Bresnan, but too wide this time as it loops over Williamson in his normal stance...although he did have a flap at it
flicked off his pads out to deep square
on off stump, thuds off Taylor's bat as he defends back to the bowler
on a length outside off, driven sweetly to backward point
tries to back cut the first ball but it gripped a little and Williamson was cramped and squeezed it away on the off side
down the wicket, swing and a miss and a missed stumping fairly regulation and Buttler will be disappointed to miss a ball that spun past Williamson's attempted drive down the ground
flighted up, flicked off the stumps through midwicket
forward, squeezed away in front of short third man for a quick single
slightly short, gets down very low and pulls hard and gets it through square leg for four, well struck

tries the same stroke but misses and is plumb lbw right in front of all three, given out immediately, Root sets off an a lap of honour. Williamson tried the same stroke as the ball before but it kept a little low on him and struck him on the back thigh bang in front of middle and off
on a length a foot outside off, late cut wide of third man

length ball that slides across the left-hander, Munro pushes at it without really moving his feet and edges to the keeper and collects a golden duck. That was not a good stroke at all, pushes hard a length ball sliding away from him and got a thin edge through to Buttler
full ball, a little straight, tucked through square leg
short ball that Taylor gets up on well and dabs it down on the on side, they take a quick single
good length on the off stump, McBren forward to block to extra cover
slightly shorter on a similar line, pushed to cover point to finish the over well
just back of a length, just outside off, Taylor stays back and late cuts well and gets it past short third man, well played
straight, low, full toss, played back to the bowler
middle stump line, flicked through square leg
full, straight ball ran back to the bowler
off stump now, pushed down the ground but short midwicket comes across and saves well
stays back and punches back to the bowler from just outside off
length, it nips in to the right-hander a little, Taylor tucks it to midwicket from the crease
similar ball played in almost identical fashion to the same fielder
a touch straight and worked behind square on the leg side
a flash of the blade to a back of a length ball a foot and a half outside off
length ball pushed to midwicket again, and Finn has kicked down the stumps, no-ball but not a free hit
length ball, pushed from off stump back towards the bowler
back of a length just outside off, Taylor stays leg side of it and slashes hard but straight to point
off stump, ran into the covers from a full length
goes to on-drive and gets an edge into the front pad
reverse-sweeps from off stump and steers it past short third man, played it well, got down low
flatter, straighter ball tucked to backward square leg

back and goes to cut and gets an edge to Buttler who has atoned for his missed stumping with a smart catch. That's a big wicket. The delivery was far too flat and straight to cut and McCullum has actually got a toe end on it, reflecting how late on the shot he was
around the wicket, forward just outside off and pressed into the covers
length ball, flicked off middle and leg to midwicket
this nips back a little and catches Taylor very high on the back pad, it runs into the off side, no idea why Finn is appealing for no chance sonny jim
just back of a length and this is straight enough to push through square leg
a little too far outside off to induce a stroke
this time Franklin pushes at it and gets it wide of mid-off for a quick single
just outside off, pushed with a lovely straight bat off the back foot to extra cover
full on the off stump, pushed down to long off
paddle swept with that delicate flick Taylor likes to use, gets it from outside off fine behind square on the leg side for a single
forward on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
forward again on the stumps, playing back towards the bowler
touch fuller and punched down to long on
a quicker ball just outside off, Taylor tries to play the stroke McCullum tried in the last over and forces it to short third man
full just outside off stump, played back to the bowler
a touch wider, played forward with a slightly open face and guides it to cover
tighter line and Franklin is hurried into defending up on the off side from the crease around middle and off
wider of off stump, left alone
length ball just outside off, dabbed into the covers
pushed at just outside off, late on the stroke and gets a thick inside edge through square leg, they run hard and get back for two
floated up just outside off, ran into midwicket
a touch fuller, pushed down to long on
a little straight, tickled around the corner to the 45
pushed forward just outside off stump, ran to backward point
straighter and pushed firmly to extra cover
a couple of inches outside off, played forward and gets it into the gap in the covers this time
fuller ball a foot outside off, driven at firmly and gets a tick outside edge that was aerial for a time but wide of backward point and down to third man coming to his left
full ball that tails in towards off stump, Taylor on-drives it without timing and mid-on fields, definite reverse-swing there
length ball just outside off, nudged at and ran down to third man

length ball just outside off, Franklin pushes at it and gets another thick edge and this time it finds Cook in the gully who holds a sharp chance. He was just a little loose outside his off stump, Broad sent another one across him on a length that invited a punching stroke through the off side but he didn't get into it as he needed to and it squirted off the edge to Cook
full and straight first up, driven back towards the bowler
goes to leave a length ball just outside off and gets a bottom edge down to third man, fortunate
swept from a good foot and a half outside off through square leg to the sweeper
forward press to a tighter line and runs it through cover point
length enables McNath to stay in the crease and clip to midwicket from off stump
gets across his stumps and paddle sweeps very fine, good job he hit it
shaped to sweep again but didn't read the flight and ended up awkwardly pushing it to point
tossed up outside off and a firm drive past extra cover, well timed stroke
driven from a fullish length on the off stump, pushed out to the cover sweeper
full ball outside off, pushed firmly at and squirts it down to third man past gully
straight line and tucks it to midwicket where Cook saves
some in-drift again for Broad, flicked down to long leg who comes in quickly as they charge back for the second and a dive saves Taylor, but he's feeling his left shoulder a little
fuller on off stump, driven firmly back to the bowler, Broad gets down to save well
length ball on off stump, pushed to extra cover
off stump, for a moment I thought McNath was gonna launch him but he pushes down to long on
same ball, a flick finds long on again
off stump, flicked to midwicket, Bell gets down to save
pushed from off stump back to the bowler, Root dives and saves off his own bowling and Taylor has to scramble back into his ground, a direct hit would have been close
pushed wide of Bell at midwicket from off stump
fuller ball, flicked down to long on
forward press just outside off, runs it through cover
full ball on the stumps, pushed down to long on
block-hole ball, dug out to midwicket, good that
full length, played forward and gets a thick inside edge into the pad that saved him there, bit of in-drift for Ravi too
length ball played off the back foot and pushed down to long on
full length ball on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
on the front foot, flicked off the stumps in the air but wide of midwicket
full ball just outside off, flicked down to long on
driven firmly at and opens the face to find the gap wide of extra cover, fine stroke, really well played that, wasn't a half-volley
now plays sensibly down to long on
back foot, flicking off the stumps to midwicket
a touch straighter and flicked very fine, it skips away from short long leg and runs into the rope
hint of width outside, driven through extra cover to the sweeper
short of a length, Taylor tries to drive off the back foot finds cover inside the circle
nearly a wicket for Bopara as Taylor drives a fraction early and spoons the ball in the air, flies just wide of short cover and lands in front of mid-off
full at middle, worked down the ground
very full outside off, strongly driven through the covers
short of a length, punched down to mid-off
cut away from off stump and picks out short third man
goes for one of his favourite strokes, the slog-sweep over deep midwicket, and comfortably clears the stands...big blow. Taylor still dangerous
low full toss, Taylor misses out and Root gets with it, as it gets flicked to midwicket
he's unable to work this one way from off stump
attempts a delicate late cut to beat short third man, but can't quite get it fine enough
worked off leg stump...Root came back very well after that six early in the over
on leg stump, flicked off his hip
pushed from a full length at off stump to midwicket
short ball down the leg side, McCullum tries to hook
outside off stump and driven out to the sweeper
waits this a fraction longer, delivered at 80mph, and Taylor opens the face to find a gap in the covers
another short ball, outside off stump this time, McCullum can't connect with a pull and the umpires are happy about the height...tight call
driven off the front foot between cover and point
flicked away off middle stump to deep square
starts outside off, shapes in a touch to Taylor, pushed to midwicket
full this time, again drifts into Taylor who works to long-on...brings up the fifty stand. Been a very composed effort so far
beats the edge as McCullum drives at quite a wide delivery which wasn't that full
good variation from Bopara, the previous ball held its line and this one nips back into McCullum
fuller on middle, pushed easily down the ground but a tidy over from Bopara
another short ball, easily ducked underneath
punched off the back foot to midwicket
tucked out to deep square

top catch! Superbly taken by Broad back-tracking from mid-off...McCullum tried to go over the infield, the delivery was back of a length and he couldn't get the distance, but it still took a fine effort from Broad
chopped down to third man
fuller outside off, drives without much footwork and gets a thick edge to third man
lovely shot by Southee, he times the ball really well...stands in his toes and punches this off the back foot through the covers
back of a length again but straighter, Southee plays it off the back foot to mid-on
punched off the back foot to mid-on
excellent short ball, 86mph, sharp from Finn and Southee gets into a tangle as he fends it off, one-handed, into the vacant square-leg area
tight to off stump, chopped down to third man
as he has a few times today, Finn pushes the ball down the leg side
fuller at the stumps, driven to mid-on
keeping a tight line trying not to offer any width, Taylor nudges into space at midwicket
short ball, 80mph, rather loops off the pitch and Southee has loads of time to sway away from the line
pushed off the back foot to cover
pulled out to deep square-leg
just a hint of width outside off allows Taylor to cut down to third man who is quite wide
another bouncer, can't have been far from a wide...which Southee also suggests with a stare towards the umpire
full at off stump, driven to mid-off who is deep enough to allow the single
back of a length, fended a little awkwardly into the off side
terrific shot this time, just backs to leg a little to open up the off side then goes up and over backward point
giving himself room to the leg side again, this time it's full from Finn and Southee can only club to midwicket
dragged down short, Southee likes the pull shot and places this well in front of deep square-leg
and he swings straight to midwicket...was angling towards the pads, tried to go over the leg side, but picked out the captain on the edge of circle
beaten by a cracking delivery, holds its line outside off stump and scoots past the edge
places this into the off side
full at middle and leg, worked towards midwicket and for a moment they considered a single...might not have made it halfway
pushed to that man at midwicket again
beats the outside edge, this one shapes away a touch and Mills is playing away from his body
nothing on offer for Mills as he can only push this back to Broad to end a tight over
cut away to backward point
this time he plays it off the front foot to backward point and opts to take the single that brings up his fifty...third of the series for Taylor
good short ball, head-height to Mills who takes a blow on the gloves as he fends to the leg side
full at off stump, driven square into the covers
well, that's a lovely piece of time...short of a length ball, Mills stands his ground and drives off the back foot through square cover
tighter to off stump, pushes into the covers which means he'll keep the strike
banged in short outside off and powered to cow corner, big swing of the bat and gets plenty on it and fetches it to the rope, well struck
full length just outside off, pushed to extra cover where there's a little fumble so they get a run
dabbed wide of extra cover from just outside off, they get another single
worked off the hip down to long leg from just back of a length
a foot outside off, Taylor goes back and dabs it down to third man
full and straight but Mills equal to it, running it past Broad and getting a quick single before mid-on can get in
full and straight, dug out with an inside edge into the front pad, it runs away into the covers
driven hard from just outside off, it was a bump ball as Bopara leapt up to take it, or tried to, going to his right
Southee-esque, full and wide of off stump, Taylor jams it out through the covers and they run exceptionally well to get a second
full again, ran out through the covers again
overpitched and Mills gets a full toss on off stump, punched just wide of mid-off for a single
Taylor steps across his stumps, Bopara tries to follow him and drags it too wide
flayed out towards deep cover with a wild top-edged drive but Trott can't get in to take the catch, might have lost it in the lights, looked catchable
flat on the stumps, slog swept on the bounce to deep midwicket and they charge back for a second, hitting to the long leg side boundary
tossed up on the stumps, dug out back to the bowler, Tredwell saves with a dive to his right

slog swept again, goes a long way up towards deep midwicket, Finn takes the catch but has to get rid of it before falling over the rope, was he still holding the ball when he landed? Yep, it's a maximum
oh dear, now a full toss and smashed into the stands, way over midwicket

another slog sweep and this time finds the fielder who is Finn again, he falls backwards again but Tim Bresnan is on hand to complete the catch, a good offload from Finn. He took the catch a foot inside the rope, then steadied himself, realised he didn't have the balance and popped the ball up the Bresnan who pocketed it and claims the dismissal!
flat delivery on off stump, played off the back foot to mid-off and they take a quick run
back of a length swung out to deep midwicket
full length and slides past the outside edge as McClenaghan plays forward
whoops, a beamer, McClenaghan gets it off the handle of the bat trying to get well out of the way, immediate apology from Bopara
back on a length, blocked up the wicket
pushed at just outside off, it runs off an inside edge to short long leg
fuller ball, pushed at just outside off, squirts off a thick outside edge and it's saved at backward point
down leg side, wide surely, no? Must have clipped the pad
big stride down the wicket and a big heave across the line, doesn't get it and find deep midwicket
a reverse paddle sweep, played with the back of the bat! Outrageous, didn't bother turning the bat and gets it fine of point
step down the wicket and a big shot over mid-off, gets it all the way over the rope, big shot
down the track again, meets it on the full and pushes back to the bowler
a big slog into the leg side, deep midwicket scrambles well and skirts the boundary but saves four
hit and run to extra cover, out with a hit, Bopara misses
slower ball outside leg stump, Mills had stepped away and in the end just blocks it
full and just outside off, Mills throws the bat at it and get it down to long on, they consider two but McClenaghan slips
full and wide, driven nicely to extra cover
slower ball on off stump, blocked in the end having initially been deceived
little straighter and pushed through square leg
slower ball, very nice, Mills came down the wicket to it but was outfoxed and in the end fended at it and missed outside off
length ball just outside off, swung at outside off and missed
swung into the off side, Broad dives at mid-off and can't quite hold on, diving to his right with one hand, got to it but couldn't hang on

length ball, square driven in the air, times it really well but there's a man out at deep point who takes the catch and England have won. It was back of a length wide of off stump, McClenaghan swung at it and caught it really nicely but the fielder at deep point was in the perfect place
